title: Neighborhood Produce Kiosk
memo: I keep thinking about how people in busy neighborhoods need easier access to fresh food. What if we had small kiosks in high-traffic areas where people could pick up their weekly produce boxes? Like a mini farmers market that's always there when you need it.
implementation: Start with 2 busy neighborhoods and see what happens
One person running it, maybe 4 hours a day Thursday to Saturday
Keep it simple: SMS orders, paper lists, then figure out the tech later
Just track the basics: did people show up, what did they swap, what's left over

title: SMS Swap Assistant
memo: People always want to change things in their boxes. What if they could just text back 'swap tomatoes for carrots' and it actually worked? No app downloads, no complicated forms, just simple text messages.
implementation: Make a list of all the ways people might say 'swap'
Give them 24 hours before delivery to make changes
Show the changes on a simple dashboard so we can handle weird requests

title: Voice Reminders for Larry SMS Hub
memo: Sometimes people don't read their SMS messages, but they usually answer their phones. What if we could call them with a friendly voice reminder about their fees or appointments? In English and Twi so it feels natural.
implementation: Write simple scripts that sound like a real person
Find a good voice that doesn't sound like a robot
If they don't answer, send the SMS as backup

title: Local Food Stories App
memo: I saw this idea somewhere and it stuck with me. What if we could tell the story of where our food comes from? Not just 'organic' labels, but actual stories about the farmers, their families, and why they grow what they grow.
implementation: Start by visiting a few local farms and taking photos
Write simple stories about the farmers and their methods
Put QR codes on produce boxes that link to the stories
Maybe add a simple way for customers to send messages to farmers

title: Community Recipe Sharing
memo: People get the same vegetables every week and sometimes don't know what to do with them. What if we could share simple recipes that actually work with what's in season? Not fancy cooking, just good food that's easy to make.
implementation: Collect recipes from local cooks and families
Test them with the actual vegetables we're selling
Share one recipe per week via SMS or simple website
Let people submit their own recipes and tips
